citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
* An approximately six year old, male white Bichon (I.D. # 841622600) was observed holding it’s left front paw up and was
non-weight bearing. Upon closer inspection one nail was long, but there was no visible injury. The license indicated he
noticed it a few days ago but had not documented the injury nor did he contact a veterinarian. A non-weight bearing limb
is indicative of possible injury or infection and is painful.
This animal needs to be seen by a veterinarian. The outcome of this consultation must be documented and provided to
the inspector upon request. The licensee must ensure that all animals receive adequate veterinary care at all times.
To be correct by: 17-July-2023.
* A female Shi Tzu (Id # 601-012-257) located in pen # 30 has an excessive build up of brownish organic matter on the
top and bottom of the back teeth. This buildup completely covered the teeth and was pushing up into the gums. A build up
of abnormal material on the teeth can be painful, impact the ability to chew and affect the overall health of the animal.
The licensee must have this dog examined by a veterinarian and documentation of diagnosis and treatment available
upon request. As indicated per the Program of Veterinary care a maintenance plan for dental care must also be adhered
to.
To be corrected by: 19-July-2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
ANGELA DEPOE, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
* An approximately six year old, male white Bichon (I.D. # 841622600) was observed holding it’s left front paw up and was 
non-weight bearing. Upon closer inspection one nail was long, but there was no visible injury. The license indicated he 
noticed it a few days ago but had not documented the injury nor did he contact a veterinarian. A non-weight bearing limb 
is indicative of possible injury or infection and is painful.  
 
This animal needs to be seen by a veterinarian. The outcome of this consultation must be documented and provided to 
the inspector upon request. The licensee must ensure that all animals receive adequate veterinary care at all times. 
 
To be correct by: 17-July-2023. 
 
* A female Shi Tzu (Id # 601-012-257) located in pen # 30 has an excessive build up of brownish organic matter on the 
top and bottom of the back teeth. This buildup completely covered the teeth and was pushing up into the gums. A build up 
of abnormal material on the teeth can be painful, impact the ability to chew and affect the overall health of the animal.  
 
The licensee must have this dog examined by a veterinarian and documentation of diagnosis and treatment available 
upon request. As indicated per the Program of Veterinary care a maintenance plan for dental care must also be adhered 
to.  
 
To be corrected by: 19-July-2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
ANGELA DEPOE, ANIMAL CARE INSPECTOR n
